records.location_details: Incident occurred during a Joint Return Operation at an airport facility, specifically in a search room during the pre-departure phase. The specific country and airport are redacted.
records.where_clear: Airport facility during a return operation, in a search room.
records.location_text_raw: Return Operation to [redacted] / airport / search room / pre-departure phase
records.uncertainty_note: Specific country and airport details are redacted.

possible_violations.legal_basis: art.1 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights
art. 2 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of torture and inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment
possible_violations.legal_basis: art. 4 of the EU Charter of Fundamental Rights

records.context_note: During a return operation, a Frontex Fundamental Rights Monitor (FROM) reported an OMS escort pressing his boot on a restrained returnee's neck, causing visible discomfort. The FROM assessed this as excessive force and a violation of fundamental rights. National authorities denied the incident and claimed standard procedures were followed. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that excessive force was used and constituted a violation of fundamental rights. The same escort was allegedly involved in a previous incident of slapping a returnee.
records.evidence_quote: the Fundamental Rights Office concludes that excessive force was used on a returnee when an escort placed his boot on a restraint returnee during the pre-departure phase
